intro: Arenaria dimorphitricha, commonly known as the two-tailed sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the arctic and alpine regions of Eurasia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers in early summer, which are clustered in racemes. Its leaves are typically hairy and adapted to withstand cold and dry conditions. Arenaria dimorphitricha is often found in rocky soils and is an important component of tundra and mountain ecosystems.
